subSections.title: Kanji
subSections.text: {{ja-kanji|grade=uc|rs=虫06}}

subSections.title: Readings
Etymology 1
subSections.text:
{{wikipedia|lang=ja|カエル}} {{wikipedia|Frog}} [[File:Agalychnis callidryas.jpg|thumb|250px|{{m|ja|蛙|tr=kaeru, kawazu, kairu}}: a '''[[frog]]'''.]]
{{ja-kanjitab|yomi=k|かえる}} {{IPAfont|⟨kaperu⟩}} → {{IPAchar|/kaperu/}} → {{IPAchar|/kaferu/}} → {{IPAchar|/kaweru/}} → {{IPAchar|/kajeru/}} → {{IPAchar|/kaeru/}} From {{inh|ja|ojp|sort=かえる|-}}. Only found once in the ''{{w|Man'yōshū}}'', completed some time after 759 CE, where it is used phonetically to spell the name of the [[maple]] tree.{{RQ:Manyoshu|8|1623}}, text [http://jti.lib.virginia.edu/japanese/manyoshu/Man8Yos.html#1623 here] Generally regarded as the informal or everyday term for {{m|en|frog}}, in contrast to the formal or poetic term ''kawazu'' (see below).{{R:Kokugo Dai Jiten}} The ultimate derivation is unclear, with numerous theories. Some of the leading ideas include: * Cognate with {{m|ja|帰る||tr=kaeru|to return (to a point of origin)}}, from the way that some species of frogs return to their birthplace to [[spawn]] * Cognate with {{m|ja|孵る||tr=kaeru|to hatch (from an egg)}}, in reference to [[tadpole]]s * Derived from [[onomatopoeia]], where ''kape'' originally referred to the [[frog]]'s [[call]], suffixed uncertain element ''-ru'' The phonetic development went through a clear stage where the middle mora was pronounced {{IPAchar|/je/}}, as illustrated in the 1603 ''{{w|Nippo Jisho}}'' entry, spelled ''cayeru''.{{R:Nippo Jisho original}}, text [https://books.google.com/books?id=TFJAAQAAMAAJ&pg=PP101 here] towards the bottom of the right-hand column This was likely a result of the {{w|Muromachi period}} sound shift, where {{IPAchar|/we/}} shifted to {{IPAchar|/je/}}, followed later by {{IPAchar|/je/}} merging into {{IPAchar|/e/}} to produce modern {{IPAchar|/kaeru/}}. Now the most common term for {{m|en|frog}}.

subSections.title: Derived terms
Etymology 2
Pronunciation
subSections.text: {{ja-pron|yomi=k|かわず|acc=0|acc_ref=DJR,NHK,SMK5}}

subSections.title: Noun
Derived terms
subSections.text: * {{ja-r|井の中の蛙大海を知らず|い の なか の かわず たいかい を しらず}}: “a frog in a well does not know the great ocean” → metaphor of a narrow world view based on limited experience
